title: ENG: Pricing/licensing-faq Refresh
description:
## Goal
The /licensing-faq page is a feeder page into the /pricing/ page and currently looks like a handbook page. There is an opportunity to improve this page to be more conversion-focused. We would like to redesign /pricing/licensing-faq/ which will improve user experience. 

### Notes
There is currently no slippers component for the accordion. We would like to have this page updated using a BE accordion component now and we will iterate to the slippers component in Q4

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When users land on the licensing page*
* **Motivation**: *We want to provide them the information they are looking for*
* **Outcome**: *So we can eventually lead them to a free trial *

## Workin Files
- [ ] [Figma design](https://www.figma.com/file/I1RYrS4BtJEvS1rpRJvgBa/Licensing-FAQ-MVC1?node-id=53%3A5419)

title: ENG: Solutions / Change 'Take GitLab for a Spin' copy
description:
## Goal
I would like to iterate on the line `Take GitLab for a Spin` which will improve clicks as measured by metrics.

This section has the lowest engagement on the page ([source](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1375#note_1118351358)) so we would like to test an alternative line of copy. I hypothesize that 'Take GitLab for a Spin' is both too vague and too aggressive. I would like to replace the line with `Try Ultimate for Free` which is a more clear and more succinct call to action.

<details><summary>Current</summary>
![Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.20_PM](/uploads/5c5f0471e3af93d69fc8218a9a84fa35/Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.20_PM.png)
</details>

<details><summary>Updated</summary>
![Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.04_PM](/uploads/af737cc463d58218fa1cacee548b96b6/Screen_Shot_2022-10-12_at_3.14.04_PM.png)
</details>

### Technical details
The current <NextStep/> component uses a universal yml file for all of the content across the site.  We will need to modify the component to look for data coming from the page yml file and have a fallback to use the current universal yml file. 

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
1. All /solution child pages 
1. https://about.gitlab.com/solutions

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Modify the current <NextStep> component to accept page data with a fall back to use the current universal yml file
- [ ] Replace ~~Take GitLab for a Spin~~ with `Try Ultimate for Free` on /solutions and /solution child pages

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: @Tinaliseng @dennischarukulvanich 
- [ ] Informed: @justin.vetter

title: ENG: Fix render blocking for Google fonts
description:
## Goal
We would like to increase our core web vital scores.  One of the line items that is hurting our scores is how Google fonts is loaded.

![CleanShot_2022-10-04_at_10.23.26](/uploads/f0c22811b237a6bf3b39a9270e6a8e02/CleanShot_2022-10-04_at_10.23.26.jpg)

* **Situation**: *When the DOM loads google fonts is blocking page render lowering our core vital score*
* **Motivation**: *We want to update to fix our core vital scores*
* **Outcome**: *So we can show increased core vital score*

Here are two articles talking about how to resolve this issue
- https://dieppa.co.uk/2020/10/21/eliminate-render-blocking-resources-google-fonts/
- https://www.tutorialjinni.com/eliminate-render-blocking-google-fonts.html

We will need to test to see if we are seeing major font popping with these options, and weigh the benefit of this change.

title: Tracking: Site Search Result dataLayer
description:

description:
## Goal

Proof of Concept localized versions of conversion driving pages using the [Smartling Global Delivery Network](https://www.smartling.com/software/global-delivery-network/) have been created on our domain using a sandbox demo from Smartling. We'd like to gain approval from stakeholders on using this service in a production capacity for about.gitlab.com before [signing a contract with Smartling](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/marketing-operations/-/issues/7033). Proof of Concept URLS to verify are: 

**French Localization**
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/why-gitlab/
- https://about.gitlab.com/fr-fr/pricing/

**Japanese Localization** 
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/why-gitlab/
- https://about.gitlab.com/ja-jp/pricing/

**German Localization** 
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/why-gitlab/
- https://about.gitlab.com/de-de/pricing/

We needed to make changes to our DNS to serve these our our doamin, which was coordinated here:

title: Release: Free Trial Conversion data in Launch Darkly
description:
## Goal
We would like to enable free trial conversion data to be collected by Launch Darkly.

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user clicks on the Free Trial nav button in navigation, data is collected by Launch Darkly for each A/B navigation test variant*
* **Motivation**: *We want to measure free trick click rates of each A/B test variant*
* **Outcome**: *So we can determine a winner based on data*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

**If this is urgent, what is the business need for the urgency?**
- [x]  Yes: We enabled our 1st [A/B test to remove register for the nav](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1356) on 2022-09-15. Since the test is live, we are not collecting correct data, therefore this issue is urgent. If we do not resolve this by 2022-09-16, we will need to stop and restart that A/B test.
- [ ]  No

If the requestor is not the DRI, find out if the DRI is aware of the request / wants to change things.

**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [x]  Yes @laurenbarker @fqureshi 
- [ ]  No

**Compliance / legal / accessibility regulations to be aware of?**
- [ ] Yes: `Please describe why`
- [ ] No: unknown

**What is the ultimate end goal vision vs the MVC1 iteration?**
 - Free trial clicks are measured in Launch Darkly for variant A and B of the navigation

 - Data is collected and visible through Launch Darkly

- [x] Yes: @dennischarukulvanich to verify
- [ ] No

title: ENG: Adding Great Place to Work badge to GitLab careers site
description:
## Goal
We would like to add a section to the GitLab careers site that highlights we are Great Place to Work certified which will provide a proof point about what it's like to work here as measured by the ratio of site visits to applications over time.

This section was designed as part of [this issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1267).

Here's the [figma](https://www.figma.com/file/JhFZCIRo8AoWrLIFDEOtL4/Careers?node-id=7%3A399).

Also dropping a mock for easy reference here: 
![image](/uploads/210bb71f8be0ba5761bb9b501b63088d/image.png)

### Jobs To Be Done
* Design a section for our careers page using an existing design pattern to highlight the attached badge and content provided by the talent brand team.
* The idea here is that we want people who visit our careers site to know that we are a Great Place to Work.
* So, they are more likely to apply for a job if there is an open role that's the right fit.

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://about.gitlab.com/jobs/

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: TBD
- [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @drogozinski 
- [ ] Informed: Devin to inform People Leadership Group, Ray/Michael to inform marketing as needed

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- Designing a small section to highlight our Great Place to Work certified badge and provided copy

- Creating the MR to add that new section seamlessly into the careers site.

- Provided copy: At GitLab, being a great place to work means building a workplace where everyone can contribute and anyone can thrive. We aim to uphold that ideal in every country where we employ GitLab team members.

- Button text: See our employer awards 
- Button link: <https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/employment-branding/content-library/#awards-and-lists-recognizing-gitlab-as-a-great-place-to-work>

## Requirements

- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research

description:
## Goal
We would like to document the marketing site approval process in the handbook. It should include the following: 

- What the process is and why it exists
- The four approval flows, from minor to major change
- What the approval labels are

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When anyone is looking for information on what the approval process is and steps, they refer to our handbook*
* **Motivation**: *We want to create a single source of truth for this process*
* **Outcome**: *So we can communicate it out effectively*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/digital-experience 

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Create a new page OR edit an existing handbook page. Your choice - where does this fit in best? 
- [ ] Collaborate on this process with Digital Experience following [GitLab's handbook first documentation strategy](https://about.gitlab.com/company/culture/all-remote/handbook-first-documentation/)
- [ ] Announcement in #whats-happening-at-gitlab channel

## Requirements
What are the requirements for this request? Checklist below is an example of common requirements, please check all that apply and adjust as necessary:

- [ ] Copy writing
- [ ] Illustration
- [ ] Custom Graphics
- [ ] Research
- [ ] Data / Analytics
- [ ] UX Design
- [x] Engineering

title: Create approval flow labels
description:
## Goal
We would like to create approval flow labels from minor to major change for all Digital Experience repositories and the www-gitlab-com repository. As part of this issue, lets define what those labels are and create them. 

### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a change is made to the marketing site, the correct approval label is applied to the merge request*
* **Motivation**: *We want to communicate the level of change via a label*
* **Outcome**: *The goal is for a member of GitLab’s Digital Experience team always to review an MR before it goes live on the Buyer Experience repo or key marketing pages in the www-gitlab-com repo.*

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?
* [Buyer Experience repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience)
* [Navigation repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/navigation)
* [Slippers repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/slippers-ui)
* [www-gitlab-com repository](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/)

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle`
- [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker 
- [ ] Informed: `Everyone`

## In scope
What is within scope of this request?

- [ ] Create group level labels for Digital Experience 
- [ ] Create project level labels for www-gitlab-com

## Out of scope
What is out of scope and not part of this iteration?

- Automation or bot work

title: Contact Page: Marketo Form Fields for Google Analytics
description:
## Goal Related: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/issues/1260#note_1086859242 Marketo forms has hidden `` fields to capture the Google Analytics client ID and tracking ID. **Method**
This script on Tag Manager fires on DOM Ready across all about.gitlab.com pages, which retrieves the IDs and appends them on the form upon a form submission:
**Example:**
On the https://about.gitlab.com/sales/ page, you can see the `gaclientid__c` and `gatrackid__c` values populate the `` fields upon a form submit:
**Engineering Issue**
There are two forms on this page: https://about.gitlab.com/company/contact/ with duplicated scripts for each form (not to mention the script on Tag Manager as well). Only the Newsletter script works, the Security one doesn't. Are there too many duplicated scripts? Or is the Security script not working properly? Also, should I pause the script on Tag Manager from firing on this page? ## Page(s) Which page(s) are involved in this request? * https://about.gitlab.com/company/contact/ ## DCI [DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci) - [ ] DRI: `GitLab Handle` - [ ] Consulted: @laurenbarker @justin.vetter - [ ] Informed: `Everyone` ## Requirements What are the requirements for this request?
